title: JazzOne
author: JazzOne
content: I want to create a BSC address but i do not want to use trust wallet.What are the options?

comments.author: bakasabo
comments.body: You can use web browsers widget like Metamask, make a wallet and it will receive BSC tokens. Here is the guide how to do it. Or you can go to https://www.myetherwallet.com/, create a wallet and it will also be capable to receive BSC tokens. What is the problem with Trust Wallet ? This is one of the easiest way to create BSC wallets. But there is an alternative like Atomic Wallet. It will create you an ETH wallet, but it suits for BSC also.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: bakasabo on August 09, 2022, 08:26:06 AMWhat is the problem with Trust Wallet ? The biggest problem with trustwallet is that it's close-source and there is no way to know how the keys have been generated and whether they are stored in their server or not. That may be why OP doesn't want to use trustwallet. The other problem with trustwallet is that it's only available on mobile and it has no desktop version.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Use Metamask then. This is how it's easy it is.https://academy.binance.com/en/articles/connecting-metamask-to-binance-smart-chainQuote from: bakasabo on August 09, 2022, 08:26:06 AMWhat is the problem with Trust Wallet ? This is one of the easiest way to create BSC wallets. But there is an alternative like Atomic Wallet. It will create you an ETH wallet, but it suits for BSC also.Despite being owned by Binance, aside from having no desktop app as mentioned by hosseinimr. Maybe OP has got some bad experiences using it. That's how it goes usually when someone don't want to use a wallet.

comments.author: CuriousGeorge
comments.body: Quote from: JazzOne on August 09, 2022, 07:42:17 AMI want to create a BSC address but i do not want to use trust wallet.What are the options?My wallet was only a choice to create your own BSC address but you can try to use various wallet to issue your BSC wallet. I meant metamask can also be used for this. Some people already mentioned myetherwallet to create BSC and yeah it's also very safe to create on MEW. I will also mention mycrypto as a way to create your BSC wallet. This is also the safest way to create your own BSC wallet.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: JazzOne on August 09, 2022, 07:42:17 AMI want to create a BSC address but i do not want to use trust wallet.If you already have an ETH address, then you will have exactly the same address on the BSC network, which has a new name, BNB Chains. In order to start using the address in the BNB Chains network, you just need to import the private key into a wallet, for example MetaMask.

comments.author: ice18
comments.body: Quote from: JazzOne on August 09, 2022, 07:42:17 AMI want to create a BSC address but i do not want to use trust wallet.What are the options?You can easily create in your desktop if you have, follow steps below,1. Download and install metamask extension here: https://metamask.io/2. Once installed create new wallet and add a new network bsc network details on this link:  https://chainlist.org/chain/56 3. Done. Save your private key or pass phrase in a secured location.

comments.author: loveselenagomez
comments.body: Quote from: JazzOne on August 09, 2022, 07:42:17 AMI want to create a BSC address but i do not want to use trust wallet.What are the options?Ok than use TokenPocket. It's available in Google Play store & esay to use.Otherwise Use Metamask, It's available on Android windows etc. Just Add Binance smart chain network in your Metamask. How to add network in metamask (google it)

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: I have used myetherwallet, metamask and atomic wallet. however as already suggested by tvplus006 you can just use your ethereum address and not anything else.It is correct to not trust a third part for that usage (and I will avoid also application on mobile).it is also possible create an "offline" wallet with https://geth.ethereum.org/downloads/ more detail here https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/getting-started#step-1-generating-accounts

comments.author: diminizio
comments.body: metemask is easier. metamask can be used for RPC networks so that metamask is widely used by people. The advantage of metamask is lightness, but in terms of security I think all wallets are the same, we must really keep our wallet access in a safe place or we will lose all the assets in the wallet.

comments.author: bonyaserg
comments.body: I think that creating a BSC is not a problem. You just need to install Metamask and the tokens will be sent to the BSC address. So it's very simple and good luck with your new app installation.

comments.author: Humility4sure
comments.body: Even as most persons advised that metamask wallet should be used. It's wise to know that web wallet like metamask are easily compromised. You need to be mindful of the fact that your funds could be stolen when you download or click on phishing links. I have a personal experience of losing my funds from metamask to a wallet address housing several stolen funds. I'll advise you go with trust or Atomic wallet as it safer compared to metamask in my opinion.

Secondly, it's not only trust wallet were you can have bsc wallet. You can get it through electrum wallet and coinomi wallet as well.

comments.author: Tony116
comments.body: Quote from: Humility4sure on August 09, 2022, 03:27:10 PMEven as most persons advised that metamask wallet should be used. It's wise to know that web wallet like metamask are easily compromised. You need to be mindful of the fact that your funds could be stolen when you download or click on phishing links. I have a personal experience of losing my funds from metamask to a wallet address housing several stolen funds. I'll advise you go with trust or Atomic wallet as it safer compared to metamask in my opinion. I think this is also one of the reasons that trust wallet to this day still don't have a PC version. I'm not a computer expert or technician but I find using a mobile wallet more convenient and secure than using a PC wallet. Virus reports on mobile are rare, unlike on PC.If OP doesn't like using trust wallet then you can also experience metamask right on your smartphone, metamask also has a mobile version.

comments.author: JohnBitCo
comments.body: Quote from: bakasabo on August 09, 2022, 08:26:06 AMWhat is the problem with Trust Wallet ? This is one of the easiest way to create BSC wallets. With trust wallets, you can create up to 10 unique addresses which is enough for most users. Maybe OP is looking to create more addresses and he is looking for alternative options. Another thing is that the Trust wallet is a closed source.There are two things that could be the possible reason for OP not to use the trust wallet.
